subject: Economics
title: Elinor Ostrom: Governing the Commons
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Elinor Ostrom: Governing the Commons.

hook.text: Economists said shared resources like fisheries and forests must be privatized or they'll be destroyed.

buildup.text: The 'tragedy of the commons' argument: individuals overuse shared resources because no one owns them.

discovery.text: Ostrom studied communities worldwide that successfully managed commons for centuries.

twist.text: She was the first (and still only) woman to win the Nobel in Economics.

climax.text: Ostrom showed a third way: communities can self-govern shared resources through trust, rules, and local knowledge.

punchline.text: The best solution to shared resource problems was hiding in fishing villages.

quiz.question: What did Ostrom discover about managing shared resources?
options: Communities can successfully self-govern common resources without privatization or state control
